intro: Cryptantha humilis var. commixta, commonly known as the desert bell, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing annual or biennial species with hairy stems and small, clustered blue to purple flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Its leaves are narrow and linear, adapted to reduce water loss in hot, dry environments. The species is part of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy flowers.
